alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued September 27 at 4:43PM EDT until September 27 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Mainland Monroe County in southwestern Florida... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 443 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Everglades National Park, or 24 miles northeast of Northwest Cape Sable, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Everglades National Park. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
